result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen D King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: As to both counts: pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of probation period or any remaining balance shall convert to a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Participate in job/vocational training.
No driving without valid WI drivers license or occupational license (as authorized).

Pay all supervision fees.
Participate in Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.
Participate in Parenting counseling.

Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Straight time, no good time - STAYED for use at agent discretion.
*7/15/2016  STAY LIFTED as to 45 days.  Straight time.  No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed by Honorable Jeffrey A. Wagner.

Associated with Charge #1
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed by defense.

Defendant Stephen D King in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen D King in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephen D King in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen D King in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Commissioner ordered the defendant remain absolutely sober during the pendency of this case.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stephen D King in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
